title: Getting Started with OBD2 Scanners for Diagnostics
summary: New to OBD2 scanners? This guide will walk you through the basics, from plugging in the device to reading and understanding your first trouble code.
content:
## What is an OBD2 Scanner?

An On-Board Diagnostics (OBD2) scanner is a device that interfaces with your car's computer. It allows you to read Diagnostic Trouble Codes (DTCs) and access a wealth of data about your vehicle's performance. All cars made since 1996 have an OBD2 port, usually located under the dashboard.

### How to Use a Scanner

1.  Locate the OBD2 port.
2.  Plug the scanner in.
3.  Turn the ignition to the 'On' position.
4.  Follow the scanner's prompts to read codes.
